security: The memo concerns the return and destruction of alias documentation issued to James P. O'Connell, which could reveal operational methods for providing false identities. Directly quoting: "The documentation in question is no longer needed and may be destroyed."
summary: A memo from the Deputy Director of Security to the Chief of the Technical Services Division, concerning the return and destruction of alias documentation for James P. O'Connell.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret memorandum, dated June 29, 1962, is from the Deputy Director of Security (Investigations and Operational Support) to the Chief of the Technical Services Division, specifically Mr. Clayton Kallander. The memo acknowledges the return of alias documentation issued to James P. O'Connell on April 6, 1962, and instructs that the documentation, which includes a California Driver's License, Social Security Card, Reserve Officer's Association Membership Card, and Traveler's Auto Insurance ID Card, is no longer needed and may be destroyed, with appreciation expressed for the prompt handling of the matter.
title: O'CONNELL, James P.
sender: Deputy Director of Security (Investigations and Operational Support)
